title: JSON schema for Google Apps Script manifest files

homepageTrigger.description: The Google Workspace add-on manifest configuration for homepage triggers.

enabled.description: Whether or not homepage (non-contextual) cards are enabled in Calendar. Defaults to true.

runFunction.description: The name of the function to run when this trigger fires. You must implement this function in your add-on project. This function must build and return an array of Card objects.

runtimeVersion.description: Version of the server to use when executing this project.

timeZone.description: The script time zone in one of the available ZoneId values such as "America/Denver".

dependencies.description: A list of advanced services and libraries.

enabledAdvancedServices.description: The list of advanced services enabled for use by the script project.

userSymbol.description: The identifier used to refer to this service in the code of the Apps Script project.

serviceId.description: The identifier of the service that is shown in the API discovery document (e.g., drive).

version.description: The enabled version of the service (e.g., "v1").

libraries.description: The list of libraries used by the script project.

userSymbol.description: The label that is used in the script project code to refer to this library.

libraryId.description: The script ID of the library's script project. You can find a script ID in the library script's URL or in the script editor by selecting **File > Project properties**.

version.description: The version of the library that is used by the script. This is either a version number or stable, meaning the last version created.

developmentMode.description: If true, version is ignored and the script uses the current library project saved code, even if that code has not been saved to a new version.

webapp.description: The script project's web app configuration. Only used if the project is deployed as a web app.

access.description: The levels of permission for running the web app.

executeAs.description: The identity under which the web app executes.

exceptionLogging.description: The location where exceptions are logged.

oauthScopes.description: The definition of authorization scopes used by the script project.

urlFetchWhitelist.description: A list of HTTPS URL prefixes. If present, any URL endpoint fetched must match one of the prefixes in this list. This can help to protect user data.

executionApi.description: The script project's API executable configuration. Only used if the project is deployed for API execution.

access.description: Determines who has permission to run the script from the API.

sheets.description: Defines manifest values specific to Sheets.

macros.description: A list of defined macros and their associated properties.

items.description: A defined macros and it's associated properties.

menuName.description: The name of the macro as it appears in the Google Sheets UI.

functionName.description: The name of the Apps Script function that executes the macro. By default this matches the menuName for functions automatically created, but this is not a requirement.

defaultShortcut.description: Defines the keyboard shortcut that executes the macro. This must be of the form Ctrl+Alt+Shift+Number, where Number is a single-digit. Macros without shortcuts can only be executed from the Tools > Macros menu.

logoUrl.description: URL for logo image of add-on.

supportUrl.description: URL for support information of the add-on.

sources.description: List of sources or services that can be accessed with this add-on.

templates.description: Map of template name to report ID.

shortDescription.description: Even shorter description used in gallery cards. Only a maximum of 114 characters will be shown on the card.

items.description: Types of Authorization supported by the add-on.

privacyPolicyUrl.description: Url for privacy policy information about the add-on.

termsOfServiceUrl.description: Url for terms of service information about the add-on.

common.description: Common properties between all G Suite add-on types.

primaryColor.description: The color of toolbar. Defaults to grey (#424242).

secondaryColor.description: The default color of buttons. Defaults to the primary color (if it is set); otherwise defaults to blue (#2196F3).

enabled.description: Whether or not homepage (non-contextual) cards are enabled. Defaults to true.

runFunctions.description: The name of the function to run

runFunction.description: Required for each defined universal action if openLink is not present. If provided, the name of the Apps Script function that executes when the user selects this action.

useLocaleFromApp.description: Use the locale from the host application?

onTriggerFunction.description: The name of the Apps Script function that executes when this contextual trigger fires (that is, when a message is opened in Gmail). The function specified here must build and return an array of Card objects.

unconditional.description: Used to specify that the contextual trigger is fired for all Gmail messages. This is currently the only option, so this should always be an empty object.

homepageTrigger.description: The trigger function specification for creating the add-on homepage in the Gmail host.

enabled.description: Whether or not homepage (non-contextual) cards are enabled in Gmail. Defaults to true.

runFunction.description: The name of the function to run when this trigger fires. You must implement this function in your add-on project. This function must build and return an array of Card objects.

homepageTrigger.description: The trigger function specification for creating the add-on homepage in the Calendar host.

enabled.description: Whether or not homepage (non-contextual) cards are enabled in Calendar. Defaults to true.

runFunction.description: The name of the function to run when this trigger fires. You must implement this function in your add-on project. This function must build and return an array of Card objects.

eventOpenTrigger.description: When a Calendar event is opened

eventUpdateTrigger.description: When a Calendar event is updated

sheets.description: Configurations for the Google Workspace Add-on's appearance and behavior within the Sheets host application.

onFileScopeGrantedTrigger.description: A configuration for a contextual trigger that fires when the add-on presents the request file scope dialog.
